titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Benjamin F. Hart papers 1977.086
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:28 +0000.

did.abstract: The Benjamin F. Hart papers span the period 1836 to 1843 and consist of two documents: a certificate that certifies Benjamin F. Hart is a Master Mason of the St. Andrew's Lodge #7 of the Freemasons, dated 1838; and Hart's last will and testament, dated 1843.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1977.
